message.content:
To identify the carrying amount of inventories sold during the reporting period based on the income statement, we typically look for the "Cost of Goods Sold" (COGS) line item. The COGS represents the direct costs attributable to the production of the goods sold by the company, which includes the carrying amount of inventories sold.

In the provided income statement:

| Account               | Amount     | Date       |
|-----------------------|------------|------------|
| Cost of Goods Sold    | 5700000.00 | 2024-02-01 |

The Cost of Goods Sold is 5,700,000.00, which represents the carrying amount of inventories sold during the reporting period.

```json
{"solution": {'value': '5700000.00'}}
```
